data.event: Woodlands' population at the time of the 2001 New Zealand Census of Population and Dwellings was 279, comprising 144 males and 135 females.

event.title: represented a decline of 6.1% or 18 people since the 1996

data.event: This represented a decline of 6.1% or 18 people since the 1996 census.
The railway has been freight-only since the cancellation of the Southerner passenger express on 10 February 2002.

event.title: was opened to Woodlands on 11 February 1874

data.event: The first section of the line out of Invercargill was opened to Woodlands on 11 February 1874.

event.title: 7 June 1875, the next section beyond Woodlands was opened

data.event: On 7 June 1875, the next section beyond Woodlands was opened to Mataura via Edendale.
